results.question: There was a satirical candidate named "Deez Nuts" running in the 2016 US presidential elections.
The first "Metal Gear" game was released for the PlayStation 1.
Toronto is the capital city of the North American country of Canada.
In "Star Trek", Klingons respect William Shakespeare, they even suspect him having a Klingon lineage.
Linus Sebastian is the creator of the Linux kernel, which went on to be used in Linux, Android, and Chrome OS.
In "Star Trek", Klingons are commonly referred to as "Black Elves".
There are 2 player roles in Trouble in Terrorist Town.
The surface area of Russia is slightly larger than that of the dwarf planet Pluto.
A defibrillator is used to start up a heartbeat once a heart has stopped beating.
In the Resident Evil series, Leon S. Kennedy is a member of STARS.
